alert.note: Alert for Grant (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 15 at 2:50AM CST until February 16 at 6:00PM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Snow Threat Increasing For Thursday... .A narrow band of heavy snow will accompany a winter storm set to track northeast across the region Thursday. Several inches of accumulation are possible, currently favored to extend from central Iowa into southern Wisconsin. With uncertainties persisting on the track of the storm, even a small waver north or south will produce a subsequent adjustment in how much could fall in your area. Be ready for refinements in the forecast as we move into Thursday. ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH THURSDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 7 inches possible. * WHERE...In Iowa, Clayton County. In Wisconsin, Grant County. * WHEN...From late tonight through Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the Thursday morning commute.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this winter storm.
